title: Vice-President polls: NDA announces candidate, picks Maharashtra governor CP Radhakrishnan
content: The BJP has announced Maharashtra Governor CP Radhakrishnan as the NDA's candidate for the Vice-President election, scheduled for September 9. This decision was finalized during a BJP Parliamentary Board meeting following Jagdeep Dhankhar's resignation. With a majority in the electoral college, the NDA is expected to win, while the opposition INDIA bloc considers fielding a candidate.

title: 'Class isn‚Äôt his strength': Ex-Pak cricketer backs Pathan after 'badtameez' jibe at Afridi
content: Danish Kaneria has supported Irfan Pathan's revelations about his rivalry with Shahid Afridi, criticising Afridi for resorting to personal attacks. Pathan recounted instances where Afridi mocked his identity, fueling his determination to dismiss him on the field. Kaneria echoed Pathan's claims, stating Afridi often targets individuals' families or religion, lacking class and decency.

title: Microsoft's new return to office plan: Company requires 3-day office attendance
content: Microsoft is mandating a return to office for employees near its Redmond headquarters, requiring at least three days a week in-person starting January 2025. This shift aligns Microsoft with other tech giants like Amazon, Google and Meta, tightening remote work policies.

title: Who is CP Radhakrishnan? Meet NDA candidate for VP polls
content: CP Radhakrishnan, the Maharashtra governor with a strong BJP background and RSS roots, has been nominated as the NDA's candidate for the upcoming Vice Presidential election, following Jagdeep Dhankhar's resignation. Radhakrishnan, a two-time Lok Sabha MP and former state BJP president, brings extensive experience in politics and governance to the role.

title: ‚ÄòMountain came down‚Äô: In Kishtwar, a desperate hunt for survivors amid rubble
content: A devastating cloudburst in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district triggered flash floods, obliterating Chasoti village. At least 60 lives were lost, with scores injured and dozens still missing. Piyra Singh, a survivor, recounted the horror as his home collapsed, claiming the lives of his relatives. Rescue operations are underway as families grapple with immense grief.

title: From 'vote chori' to CCTV to house no. zero: How EC countered oppn allegations
content: Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar addressed opposition claims of electoral roll manipulation in Bihar, emphasizing the Election Commission's impartiality. He highlighted the collaborative and transparent nature of the Special Intensive Revision process, involving voters and party representatives.

title: Apple's H-1B pay breakdown: How much iPhone maker pays engineers, designers & more
content: Apple, a tech giant with a market capitalization exceeding $3 trillion, is actively recruiting for numerous AI and machine learning positions. According to a federal filing, these roles offer substantial base salaries, with some positions reaching up to $468,500 for human interface designers. CEO Tim Cook emphasizes the company's commitment to hiring diverse talent and fostering a collaborative environment.

title: Viral video: Kohli, wife Anushka enjoy London stroll; duo seen interacting with locals
content: Virat Kohli and Anushka Sharma were recently spotted enjoying a leisurely walk in London, interacting warmly with locals. This break precedes Kohli's preparations for the significant Australia series in October. Meanwhile, Kohli celebrated India's thrilling 6-run victory against England in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy, praising Mohammed Siraj's match-winning performance and dedication. Kohli has always acknowledged Siraj's evolution as a bowler.

title: 'Don't ...': Lee issues stern warning to Jadeja despite hailing him as best all-rounder
content: Ravindra Jadeja's recent batting performance in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy has drawn praise, but Brett Lee humorously warns that Jadeja's sword celebration might be his biggest injury risk. Lee regards Jadeja as the world's best all-rounder, highlighting his fitness and complete skillset. He also predicts Jadeja will surpass 100 Test matches, a milestone Lee equates with GOAT status.

title: ‚Äò82% stake sold‚Äô: Tesla exec offloads shares; Musk renews short seller threat
content: Tesla's Tom Zhu has sold over 82% of his Tesla shares since 2023. The sales occurred between 2023 and 2024. Elon Musk warned short sellers of potential losses if Tesla achieves full autonomy. Musk has clashed with Bill Gates over Gates' alleged short position against Tesla. This position reportedly cost Gates $1.5 billion.

title: Rodman slams Travis Hunter:'Don‚Äôt be like me'; Leanna Lenee relationship sparks backlash
content: Dennis Rodman ignited controversy by criticizing NFL star Travis Hunter's marriage to Leanna Lenee during a live Twitch stream. Rodman's unexpected jab added fuel to existing online scrutiny of the couple's relationship. Hunter has publicly defended his wife against accusations of exploitation, asserting his love and dismissing the negativity surrounding their union, which culminated in a recent Tennessee wedding.

title: NYC restaurant mass shooting: At least 3 dead, 8 injured as multiple gunmen open fire
content: In a tragic incident in Brooklyn's Crown Heights, three individuals lost their lives and eight others sustained injuries after multiple gunmen unleashed gunfire inside a restaurant early Sunday morning. Responding to the scene, authorities discovered at least 36 shell casings, initiating an ongoing investigation to identify and apprehend the suspects.

title: 'Laughable': Congress on EC's 'no ruling, oppn bias'; continues its 'EC-BJP' consensus attack
content: Congress has launched a scathing critique of the Election Commission of India, dismissing its claims of impartiality as "laughable." Jairam Ramesh accused the ECI of incompetence and partisanship, particularly regarding the Special Intensive Revision of Bihar's electoral rolls.

title: H-1B visa hiring gap revealed: Why top US tech giants favour immigrants over citizens
content: American STEM graduates face hidden recruitment practices favoring H-1B visa holders in top tech firms, despite universities' efforts to provide job-ready skills. Companies often use specialized channels, bypassing standard recruitment, creating an education-opportunity mismatch. Awareness of these practices and visa pathways is crucial for domestic talent to compete fairly and access coveted positions.

title: No Babar, No Rizwan! Ex-cricketer backs Pakistan squad: 'This team can beat India'
content: Pakistan has announced a surprising 17-member squad for the upcoming triangular T20I series and Asia Cup 2025, notably excluding Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan. Led by Salman Ali Agha, the team emphasises aggressive batting. Director high-performance Aqib Javed confidently stated the team's capability to defeat India in the Asia Cup, despite political tensions and calls for boycotts.

title: Big EU huddle at Zelenskyy-Trump meet: Meloni, Macron, others to back Ukraine cause
content: Volodymyr Zelenskyy will meet Donald Trump with European leaders and Nato. Ursula von der Leyen and Giorgia Meloni will join him at the White House. Emmanuel Macron, Friedrich Merz, Mark Rutte, and Keir Starmer will also be present. This aims to prevent a US-Russia deal against Ukraine. It follows Trump's meeting with Vladimir Putin, excluding Zelenskyy.

title: 'Don't push him towards early retirement': Manjrekar slammed for Bumrah comments
content: Aakash Chopra defends Jasprit Bumrah's selective Test appearances, countering Sanjay Manjrekar's criticism. Chopra emphasizes the necessity of bowler rotation in lengthy series, highlighting India's bowling depth showcased by Akash Deep and Prasidh Krishna. He argues for prioritizing Bumrah's longevity, recognizing his exceptional value to the team, even with limited Test participation.

title: Watch: CCTV captures moment of firing at Elvish Yadav‚Äôs Gurgaon home
content: A shocking CCTV footage revealed two masked men firing over ten rounds outside YouTuber Elvish Yadav's Gurgaon residence. Gangsters Neeraj Faridpur and Bhau Ritolia, associated with the Himanshu Bhau gang, claimed responsibility, alleging Yadav promoted a betting app. Fortunately, no one was injured, and police have launched an investigation, analyzing CCTV evidence to apprehend the suspects.

title: 1,390 games! Fabio creates football history, equals Peter Shilton‚Äôs all-time record
content: Brazilian goalkeeper Fabio has equaled Peter Shilton's record for the most competitive appearances in men's football, marking his 1,390th game in Fluminense's victory over Fortaleza. The 44-year-old veteran expressed gratitude to his family and faith after the milestone. He is now set to surpass Shilton's record in the upcoming Copa Sudamericana match.

title: Patrick Mahomes on Chiefs training camp: 'You get to try stuff'
content: Patrick Mahomes concluded Chiefs training camp, energized by the team's youth and focused on self-improvement. He utilized scout team practices to experiment with trick plays and refine his throwing skills. Mahomes values the blend of young talent and veteran leadership, preparing the Chiefs for a challenging start to the NFL season with renewed determination.

title: Village near Nainital that turns into island in monsoon; traps residents for 3 months
content: Khuriakhatta, a village in Nainital, Uttarakhand, also known as 'Sri Lanka Tapu,' faces annual isolation due to monsoon floods, transforming it into a seasonal island. Villagers grapple with lack of electricity since 1984, a defunct primary school since 2011, and land erosion.

title: 'My intent was to ...': Ashwin clears air on CSK‚Äôs Dewald Brevis signing row
content: R Ashwin has clarified his remarks regarding Dewald Brevis' mid-season signing by CSK, emphasising his focus was on Brevis' batting prowess, not the financial aspects of the deal. CSK affirmed the legitimacy of Brevis' signing as an injury replacement, stating it fully complied with IPL regulations. Ashwin lauded CSK's acquisition of Brevis, highlighting his exceptional batting form and potential impact.

title: 'His legs are shackled': Ex-India batter on why Rahul is behind in Asia Cup race
content: Aakash Chopra believed that KL Rahul is still in contention for the Asia Cup, but his inconsistent approach is hindering his chances in India's T20I setup. Chopra highlighted Rahul's ability to dominate but noted his occasional slow starts and competition for top-order spots. To secure his place, Rahul needs to shed his conservative reputation and showcase his full potential.

title: Rahul Gandhi kicks off ‚ÄòVoter Adhikar Yatra‚Äô in Bihar: 16 days, 1,300 km, 20 districts
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi initiated the 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' in Bihar, a 16-day march spanning over 1,300 km across 20 districts, joined by RJD leaders Lalu Prasad Yadav and Tejashwi Yadav. The campaign protests the Election Commission's voter list revision, labeled as "vote chori" by the Congress.

title: 'If we leave Tests to wealthy, it dies slow death': Ex-Australia pacer Johnson
content: Mitchell Johnson has disagreed with Cricket Australia CEO Todd Greenberg's statements. Greenberg believes not all countries need to play Test cricket. Johnson suggests a two-tier system for Test cricket. He says wealthy nations should help smaller cricket boards. Johnson believes limiting Test cricket to wealthy nations would hurt its future. He emphasizes that Test cricket needs more participating countries.

title: 'No ruling side or opposition for us': EC in first presser since Bihar SIR
content: The Election Commission refuted opposition claims of bias following the Bihar special intensive revision, emphasizing its impartiality towards all political parties. CEC Gyanesh Kumar addressed concerns about misinformation surrounding the revision, defending the transparency of the electoral process involving numerous personnel.

title: Bihar shocker: Blinkit delivery boy shot dead in Patna
content: In a tragic incident in Patna, a 25-year-old Blinkit delivery worker, Raj Krishna, was fatally shot near Saristabad turn on Sunday. He succumbed to his injuries while receiving treatment at PMCH. Police are investigating the incident, suggesting it followed an altercation between delivery workers. Authorities are probing whether a personal dispute or another motive led to the shooting.

title: Dhoni to become India's head coach? Gambhir‚Äôs mixed results revive debate
content: Aakash Chopra believes MS Dhoni is unlikely to pursue coaching roles, citing the demanding nature of the job and Dhoni's desire to spend time with family after years of playing. Despite serving as a mentor in the past, Dhoni's continued playing career and the extensive commitment required for a full-time coaching position make it improbable.

title: ‚ÄòNetanyahu a problem‚Äô: Danish PM calls for EU sanctions over Gaza
content: Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen has criticized Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, labeling him a "problem in himself." She expressed Denmark's intent to increase pressure on Israel due to the war in Gaza, citing the catastrophic humanitarian crisis and new settlement projects.

title: Harvard trained nutritionist advises stopping this supplement before blood tests
content: A doctor's video is going viral about biotin. Biotin is a common ingredient in hair, skin, and nail supplements. It can interfere with blood tests. This includes tests for heart attacks and thyroid issues. High doses can cause false results. Patients should stop taking biotin before blood tests. They must also inform doctors about biotin intake. This ensures accurate diagnoses.

title: 'Asked to improve': Pakistan coach reveals why Babar Azam was left out of Asia Cup
content: Pakistan unveiled its squad for the upcoming T20I series and Asia Cup, notably excluding Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan in a strategic shift towards aggressive batting. Coach Mike Hesson emphasized Babar's need to improve his strike rate and play against spin, suggesting his participation in the Big Bash League as a crucial opportunity to showcase his evolution.

title: Caught on cam: Man stabbed outside house in broad daylight in MP
content: In Dhar town's Naugaon area, Virendra Bhati was brutally stabbed outside his residence by two unidentified assailants. Posing as address seekers, the attackers ambushed Bhati, inflicting severe hand injuries as he defended himself. CCTV footage captured the assault, showing the assailant repeatedly stabbing Bhati before fleeing. Passersby rushed the injured man to Dhar District Hospital.

title: PM Modi inaugurates Rs11,000-cr worth highway projects for Delhi-NCR
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated two significant highway projects in Delhi-NCR, totaling nearly Rs 11,000 crore. These projects include the Delhi section of the Dwarka Expressway and the Alipur‚ÄìDichaon Kalan stretch of Urban Extension Road-II (UER-II).

title: Rahul Gandhi calls SIR 'conspiracy to steal Bihar election'; attacks ECI
content: Rahul Gandhi accused the Election Commission of India of plotting to rig the upcoming Bihar elections. He claimed that elections are being stolen nationwide. Gandhi asserted that the INDIA bloc will conduct a caste census. He thanked Lalu Prasad Yadav for attending the rally despite health concerns. The Congress leader addressed a 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' event in Sasaram, Bihar.

title: Delhi: Man rapes mother after accusing her of having 'bad character'
content: In a shocking incident in Delhi's Hauz Qazi, a 39-year-old man has been booked for allegedly raping his mother. The woman, who had just returned from a pilgrimage to Saudi Arabia with her husband and daughter, accused her son, Md Firoz, of multiple sexual assaults this month.

title: Explained: The rise of fake productivity at work to look busy
content: A new workplace habit called fake productivity is spreading. Many employees pretend to be busy to manage work-life balance. Leaders are concerned about productivity in hybrid work environments. Task-masking involves doing micro-tasks to show effort without achieving real results. This behavior is linked to return-to-office pressures and surveillance. Telepressure from constant messaging leads to burnout.

title: 'Industrial-scale liar': BJP reacts after Gurkirat Dang denies voting multiple times
content: BJP IT Cell head Amit Malviya has strongly criticized Rahul Gandhi's claims of electoral irregularities, labeling him a liar after Gandhi alleged multiple voting instances. Malviya highlighted Gurkirat Singh Dang's public denial of Gandhi's accusations, where Dang refuted voting multiple times and demanded evidence or an apology. The BJP dismisses Gandhi's allegations as baseless and politically motivated.

title: E20 fuel rollout: Mileage dip, engine woes reported‚Äî what car owners have to say
content: The rollout of E20 fuel in India has sparked concerns among vehicle owners regarding fuel efficiency and performance. Many report mileage drops and engine issues, particularly in non-E20-compliant vehicles. While the government touts economic and environmental benefits, experts emphasize the need for greater consumer awareness and OEM education to mitigate negative impacts.

title: Man sends bomb to love interest‚Äôs husband in music speaker
content: Chhattisgarh police foiled a murder plot by arresting Vinay Verma, who sent an IED disguised as a music system to the husband of a woman he was obsessed with. The investigation uncovered an illegal explosives supply network, leading to six more arrests. Authorities seized gelatin sticks and detonators, revealing a dangerous scheme and preventing a potential tragedy.

title: China hands over third Hangor-class submarine to Pakistan
content: China's delivery of the third Hangor-class submarine to Pakistan significantly enhances Islamabad's naval capabilities amidst Beijing's growing presence in the Indian Ocean. Equipped with advanced sensors and weaponry, these submarines aim to maintain regional power balance and maritime security, according to Pakistani officials.

title: BO collection day 4: 'War 2' crosses Rs 150 cr mark; ‚ÄòCoolie‚Äô close to Rs 170 cr
content: The spy thriller 'War 2,' starring Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR, and Kiara Advani, had a strong opening, earning ‚Çπ52 Cr on its first day and crossing ‚Çπ150 crore by day four. Despite competition from Rajinikanth's 'Coolie,' which initially led, 'War 2' saw a dip in collections after the initial surge.

title: Inside the hidden costs of football: The '88 Saints speak out
content: Nearly 40 years after their time in the NFL, the players from the 1988 New Orleans Saints grapple with the physical toll of football while honoring a bond forged through the toughest game.

title: Sources: Bama RB Miller set to miss FSU opener
content: Alabama won't have its top returning rusher for the season opener against Florida State after Jam Miller suffered an upper-body injury in a scrimmage, sources told ESPN.

title: Dominant Chimaev wrestles Du Plessis' title away
content: Khamzat Chimaev controlled Dricus Du Plessis for more than 21 minutes and set a UFC record for total strikes to win the middleweight title at UFC 319.

title: Brewers rally again to win record 14th straight
content: Andruw Monasterio hit a three-run home run in the 11th inning, and the Milwaukee Brewers won their franchise-record 14th game.

title: Chargers' Johnston has concussion after hard hit
content: Chargers WR Quentin Johnston exited Saturday's preseason game on a cart after taking a big hit that left him motionless for several minutes, and head coach Jim Harbaugh said he has a concussion.

title: 'I've arrived': Jeanty makes powerful statement
content: Rookie RB Ashton Jeanty had his "I'm here" moment against the 49ers on Saturday, delivering some big plays -- and big hits -- in the Raiders' second preseason game.

title: Dart impresses again, but QB plans unchanged
content: Giants rookie Jaxson Dart continues to impress in preseason, but coach Brian Daboll reiterated that Russell Wilson is still New York's starting quarterback.

title: Harbaugh mum on U-M sanctions: 'Not engaging'
content: Jim Harbaugh is refusing to comment on the NCAA's decision to fine Michigan tens of millions of dollars and to suspend football coach Sherrone Moore for a third game due to the sign-stealing scandal that occurred during Harbaugh's tenure there.

title: White: 'Billion-to-1' odds Jones fights on WH card
content: UFC CEO Dana White all but nixed the idea of Jon Jones fighting at the promotion's proposed event at the White House in 2026, saying, "I would not bet on it."

title: Ultimate Draft Board: Perfect picks for every round in a 12-team league
content: Mike Clay provides his blueprint for 2025 fantasy football drafts, including ideal selections in each round and overall strategy.

title: Tory Horton, Jaxson Dart, Adonai Mitchell among deep sleepers for 2025
content: These sleepers are truly for those in deeper leagues seeking off-the-radar types who may emerge in 2025.

title: Little League, big dreams: Mets, Mariners players as Little Leaguers
content: From Cal Raleigh to Juan Soto, here's what players in this year's Little League Classic looked like as Little Leaguers themselves.

title: Bills backup Mitchell Trubisky reminisces on time in Chicago
content: Securing the QB2 job is the next step for Trubisky in hopes of reaching his ultimate, and difficult, goal to once again become a starter.

title: Why Bryce Young, C.J. Stroud's childhood bond will 'never waver'
content: Their friendship dates back to AAU hoops and a high school football game to settle the best team in California.

title: Premier League updates: Chelsea held after Eze goal ruled out
content: Chelsea were held to a 0-0 draw at home to Crystal Palace, while Nottingham Forest thrashed Brentford 3-1. Arsenal travel to Man United later. Join us for updates.

title: Bowl projections: Every matchup from the Celebration Bowl to the national title game
content: It's August and no games have been played, but we're breaking down who will be where in December and beyond.

title: üéµ Taylor Swift joins Kelce brothers on 'New Heights'
content: The superstar debuted on Jason and Travis Kelce's "New Heights" podcast, talked about becoming a football fan -- and even caught Caitlin Clark's attention.

title: üìà NFL Future Power Rankings
content: We ranked all 32 NFL franchises' expectations for 2025 through 2027. Which teams are set up to thrive in the future?

title: üèà Predicting best, worst scenarios for NFL teams
content: We simulated best-case and worst-case scenarios for every team, and our NFL reporters picked the biggest variables.

title: üèÄ Is there any coming back for banned Knicks fans?
content: Despite backlash, MSG Entertainment's "attorney exclusion list" is still in effect, reportedly banning over a thousand lawyers since 2022.

title: Is Flagg a ROY lock? How 11 rookies can challenge the No. 1 pick
content: NBA analyst Kevin Pelton groups 11 players most likely to threaten the Mavericks' No. 1 pick for the auspicious award.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United to bring De Gea back?
content: Manchester United could bring goalkeeper David de Gea back to the club. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: CPI(M) general secretary M.A. Baby slams Naidu‚Äôs silence on resettlement of Polavaram-displaced ¬†
content: MPs elected from Andhra Pradesh since 2014 are to be blamed for failing to raise their voice for Polavaram R&R, says Mr. Baby

title: New projects on the Godavari justifiable only after share of surplus waters is decided, says Telangana Deputy CM Mallu Bhatti Vikramarka
content: The share of surplus waters can be decided only after the ongoing projects are completed and water allocations made, he says

title: 185 people crossed a line
content: Last month, when Pakistani nationals in Gujarat got Indian citizenship under the CAA, they rejoiced. Escaping alleged persecution and insecurity, many have waited for over a decade for this having come over the border on tourist visas. Abhinay Deshpande reports on their relief, the struggle behind the paperwork and their children‚Äôs prospects

title: Kerala showcases a secular cultural alternative to the world, says Minister K. Rajan
content: International Literary Festival opens in Thrissur; Kerala Sahitya Akademi auditorium named after writer M.T. Vasudevan Nair¬†

title: Maharashtra Governor C.P. Radhakrishnan is NDA‚Äôs Vice Presidential candidate
content: C.P. Radhakrishnan considered a statesman, commands respect in all sections of society in Tamil Nadu: BJP chief JP Nadda¬†

title: Kuttanad cannot be treated as a political laboratory: Archbishop
content: He questions the apathy of governments towards the problems of Kuttanad residents, who face daily hardships due to waterlogging for last four months and the resulting crisis in the agricultural sector.

title: Villagers cautioned as flood level rises in Godavari
content: Collector K. Vetri Selvi directs officials to be on high alert, while a control room has been opened at Eluru Collectorate; MP Putta Mahesh Kumar asks officers to evacuate villagers from low-lying areas

title: SIT officials will decide on whether to continue with probe, says Home Minister
content: Seeking that the alleged mass burial issue in Dharmasthala should not be politicised, Home Minister G. Parameshwara has said that Special Investigation Team officials will decide on whether to continue the probe or not¬†

title: Siddaramaiah is behind conspiracy against Dharmasthala, says Ashok
content: Urban Naxals are spreading slander against the holy place, according to Leader of Opposition in the Assembly

title: PM Modi Urges States To Cooperate In Implementing Proposed GST Reforms
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said the Centre has circulated the draft of the next-generation GST reforms among states and sought their cooperation to implement the proposal before Diwali.

title: Affidavit Or Apology: Election Commission's 7-Day Ultimatum To Rahul Gandhi
content: Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar hardened his stance today regarding Rahul Gandhi's "vote theft" allegations, saying noting less than an affidavit on the matter or apology to the country will do.

title: BJD President Naveen Patnaik Hospitalised Due To Age-Related Problems
content: BJD chief and Leader of the Opposition in Odisha Assembly, Naveen Patnaik, was admitted to a private hospital here on Sunday due to age-related ailments, party leaders said.

title: Chennai Animal Lovers Protest In Rain For Street Dogs Amid Top Court's Order
content: Braving heavy rain showers, more than a thousand animal lovers took to the streets of Chennai today, demanding justice for community dogs.

title: Yogi Adityanath Government's 'School Pairing' Policy Sparks Political Row In Uttar Pradesh
content: What began as an administrative exercise to merge under-enrolled schools in Uttar Pradesh has snowballed into a veritable political flashpoint, sparking protests, poster wars, FIRs and heated exchanges in the state's Assembly.

title: "New Wave Of Genocide": Hamas Slams Israel's Gaza Relocation Plan
content: Hamas said on Sunday that Israel's planned Gaza relocation plan by Israel constitutes a "new wave of genocide and displacement" for hundreds of thousands of residents in the area.

title: 3 Killed, 8 Injured After Shooting In Crowded New York Club
content: Three people are dead and eight others wounded after a shooting in a crowded New York City club early Sunday morning.

title: Rajasthan Tiger Safari Horror: Guide Leaves Tourists In The Middle Of Jungle
content: In a shocking case of alleged negligence at Rajasthan's Ranthambore National Park, a group of tourists were left stranded in the park's zone 6 for nearly 90 minutes in a forest full of tigers after their safari canter broke down.

title: "Nightmare We Want To Wake Up From": Sunjay Kapur's Sister On Family Feud
content: Mandhira Kapur, the sister of Sona Comstar Chairman Sunjay J Kapur, in strongly worded comments slammed those who are being harsh on her family at a time of loss, and vowed to stand by her 80-year-old mother.

title: 2 Dead, Over 300 Injured During 'Dahi Handi' Festivities In Mumbai
content: The death count in 'Dahi Handi' festivities in Mumbai on Saturday touched two after a 14-year-old 'govinda' was declared dead on arrival by doctors in a hospital in Ghatkopar, a civic official said.

title: Tamil Nadu Governor Doing "Cheap Politics" Than Opposition, Says MK Stalin
content: Chief Minister M K Stalin on Sunday mounted a scathing attack on Tamil Nadu Governor R N Ravi, accusing him of doing "cheap politics" than the opposition and charged him with spreading canards against the ruling DMK and the party-led government.

title: Malnutrition In Madhya Pradesh: Another Child Dead, Rehab Admissions Rise
content: Another child has lost her life to malnutrition in Madhya Pradesh, bringing the state's decades-long health crisis back into sharp focus.

title: How AI Helped Maharashtra Cops Crack Hit-And-Run Case Within 36 Hours
content: The man was notably short on specifics. All he knew was that the truck that ran over his wife in Nagpur had red markings on it. He could neither identify its size nor make. The police used AI to help arrest the accused within 36 hours.

title: Congress Send Notice To MLA Who Said DK Shivakumar Will Be Next Chief Minister
content: The Congress State Disciplinary Committee on Sunday served a show cause notice to Channagiri MLA Basavaraju V Shivaganga for his statement that Deputy Chief Minister D K Shivakumar will become the next Karnataka CM.

title: Assam Government Evicts 309 Families From 23 Hectares Of Land
content: The Assam government on Sunday began an eviction drive in Biswanath district, displacing 309 families, officials said.

title: "Voters' Photos Shared Without Consent": Election Body Slams Rahul Gandhi
content: Coming out strongly against senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's allegations of 'vote fraud', the Election Commission of India has said that using "improper words" such as "vote chori" amounts to insulting the Constitution.

title: Shot Down 300 Ukrainian Drones, Hit Key Missile Storage Sites: Russia
content: Russian forces shot down 300 Ukrainian drones and struck storage sites for Sapsan missiles. At the same time, fierce battles raged in the Donetsk region, where Ukrainian forces were trying to halt a Russian advance.

title: "BJP's Vote Theft Has Been Caught, Poll Body Left Embarrassed": AAP Leader
content: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) has backed the INDIA bloc's allegation of vote theft against the BJP, slamming the Election Commission (EC) for failing to uphold free and fair polls in the country.

title: "New Conspiracy To Steal Bihar Elections": Rahul Gandhi On Poll Roll Revision
content: Rahul Gandhi's comments came during the launch of his 1,300 km-long 'Voter Adhikar Yatra' from Bihar's Sasaram.

title: "Those Who Dance With Constitution Trampled It": PM's Law Jab At Congress
content: Targeting the Opposition and senior Congress leader, Rahul Gandhi, Prime Minister Narendra Modi today alleged that "those who dance with the Constitution on their heads" kept oppressive laws in place for decades before he started repealing them.

title: Board of Governors of Digital University Kerala to meet on Monday
content: First-ever meeting of BoG in over three months. Reappointment of  Ciza Thomas as interim Vice-Chancellor has paved the way for the meeting

title: Bill to decriminalise minor offences to be introduced in the Lok Sabha on Monday
content: Over 350 provisions are proposed to be amended through the Bill; the legislation is part of the government‚Äôs effort to improve the country‚Äôs business climate

title: Andhra Pradesh likely to see a 20-cm rise in sea level by 2050 due to global warming
content: The Draft State Action Plan on Climate Change assesses that the rise in sea level will be approximately 0.20 metres in 25 years along Nellore, Guntur and West Godavari; it also estimates that 35,000 hectares of prime agricultural land in coastal Andhra Pradesh will become saline

title: PM says Sharnbaswappa Appa showed true spirituality is in Seva Paramo Dharma
content: Narendra Modi describes the death of Appa as a great loss not only to his family and countless followers but also to the entire nation

title: As water levels rise in reservoirs and rivers swell, flood fear grips Pathanamthitta residents
content: Authorities open the shutters of Kakki-Anathodu reservoir and Moozhiyar dam, causing Pampa river to swell. Blanket ban on Sabarimala pilgrims entering the river.

title: 70% of buildings in Bengaluru illegal, says Dy. CM; orders audit of weak and illegal structures in city
content: Shivakumar, who visited Nagarathpet where five people were killed in a fire on Saturday, expressed concerns over the conditions in which people were living in the locality

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu for New Delhi on August 18
content: The Chief Minister is scheduled to attend the NDA leaders‚Äô meeting on August 20 and also take part in the nomination programme of the alliance‚Äôs Vice-Presidential candidate

title: Dissolve SIT in burial case immediately or face people‚Äôs ire, says Chakravarti Sulibele
content: The police are following an anonymous man who claims to show them a mass burial site but it is not yielding any results, according to the activist

title: BJP Parliamentary board meeting begins at party headquarters
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, BJP President J.P. Nadda, Union Home Minister Amit Shah, and Defence Minister Rajnath Singh arrived at the BJP headquarters in the national capital

title: Chennithala seeks Vigilance probe into alleged corruption in PM-KUSUM implementation
content: Chennithala reiterates charge that top Anert officials were involved in manipulations in the selection of bidders for the PM-KUSUM scheme

title: Hubballi‚Äôs visually challenged boy selected for exchange programme in the Netherlands

title: Watch: Long wait for new BJP president | Talking Politics

title: Rainfall alert: SCR officials to maintain vigil at bridges, RUBs and tunnels

title: ECI stands 'thoroughly exposed' for incompetence, partisanship: Congress

title: Time to think big in a rising India, Dalmia Bharat CEO tells youth
content: The idea of a rising India and the time for thinking big have come together for graduates to leverage their career potential with a careful blend of ancient wisdom and modern technology, says Puneet Dalmia, managing director and CEO of Dalmia Bharat Ltd.,

title: Major mishap averted as beam falls during Aroor-Thuravoor elevated highway construction
content: The beam fell down while being dismantled. Traffic had been blocked during the dismantling, which helped avert a major tragedy

title: Report recommends expansion of Kerala‚Äôs list of Socially and Educationally Backward Classes
content: Recommendation to include 28 OBC communities to the SEBC. Reservation benefits in higher education are finalised on the basis of the SEBC list. Since these 28 communities are included only in the OBC list and not in the SEBC one, they are currently ineligible to claim these benefits

title: Orange alert for Kodagu as rain gains momentum; flood alert issued as outflow from KRS to be increased

title: ‚õ≥ Augusta National ditches masses for revenue

title: üèà Fantasy Football Draft Guide: All you need

title: The NBA schedule is out! Best games -- and beefs -- to watch
content: the regular season begins Oct. 21 with reigning NBA champion Kevin Durant 's new team, the Houston Rockets . leBron James , Luka Doncic and the Los Angeles Lakers host Stephen Curry and the Golden State Warriors . plenty of stars will don new jerseys setting up must-see reunions and playoff rematches as the season approaches .

title: NFL preseason Week 2 takeaways: Giants rookie QB Jaxson Dart continues red-hot summer

title: What NFL scouts make of Arch Manning, what Texas can expect from him
